intro: Sulcorebutia tiraquensis var. oenantha, commonly known as the Tiraquén rose. This succulent is native to the Andes of Peru and is characterized by its compact, rounded growth habit. It features fleshy, ribbed stems that are often covered in a layer of white or light-colored hair. The plant produces clusters of small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink or red during the spring. It is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water and well-draining soil.
